01 Dec 2017

Tender Beef Wrap

Perfect for a meal on the go!

Ingredients:

Wrap:

  • flour 120 grams
  • 75 grams of water
  • 1 gram of salt

Tender beef:

  • 200 grams of beef
  • salt 2 grams
  • ginger 5 grams
  • cooking wine 10 grams
  • 1 gram of black pepper
  • tomato sauce 30 grams
  • 3 grams of corn starch
  • sugar 5 grams

Optional:

  • Thai hot peppers
  • prepared lettuce leaf 4 pieces.

Cooking Steps

  1. First cut the beef into strips as shown. Slightly frozen beef is easier to cut into strips.

  2. Add the salt, ginger, cooking wine, black pepper, tomato sauce, corn starch, and sugar to the beef.

  3. Mix by hand and let the beef marinated while you make the wrap.

  4. Optional: cut the hot peppers into small pieces, if intended to add to the wrap

  5. Now we make the wrap dough. Add salt and water to the flour and knead the dough, adjust water as needed. Knead into a ball, transfer the dough onto a chopping board and continue to knead for 5 minutes or so until it becomes smooth and elastic.

  6. Knead the dough into a strip and then cut into 8 equal pieces.

    7.    

  7. Form the dough into a ball, set to rest for 20 minutes (cover the surface with plastic wrap or a damp cloth to prevent drying).

  8. While the dough rests, preheat the electric baking pan.

  9. Apply a layer of vegetable oil on the countertop. Place a ball of dough and flatten with a rolling pin, then roll it out.

  10. Roll out the dough and cover with a layer of vegetable oil.

  11. Do the same with another dough ball, and stack the two with the oil covered side facing each other

  12. Roll out the wrap till it is large and thin.

  13. In the preheated electric baking pan, brush on a layer of vegetable oil. Place the rolled out wrap onto the pan.

  14. Cook the wrap for about 1 minute 15 seconds. Repeat this process with the rest of the dough until you have 4 wraps.

  15. Once you are done cooking the wrap, you can also cook the beef in the electric pan.

  16. Pour some vegetable oil into the pan, add the red pepper slices (if you are using). Fry until fragrant then add the marina
     

  17. Stir fry until the beef is cooked

  18. Place the fried beef on a plate

  19. Place down a wrap, then a piece of lettuce, then add some of the fried beef.

  20. Take the wrap along the edge and fold up. As shown above.

  21. Turn over and you have completed the Tender Beef Wrap.
